titleStmt.title: A mite to the treasury, of consideration in the Common-Wealth, by severall queries, and such like particulars, in reference to its present state, a representative, religion, law, tythes, lords of manors, taxes and excise, publick debts, accounts, liberty, &c. By J.W. a well-wisher to the publique.
titleStmt.author: J. W., well-wisher to the publique.

titleStmt.title: A mite to the treasury, of consideration in the Common-Wealth, by severall queries, and such like particulars, in reference to its present state, a representative, religion, law, tythes, lords of manors, taxes and excise, publick debts, accounts, liberty, &c. By J.W. a well-wisher to the publique.
titleStmt.author: J. W., well-wisher to the publique.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by T. Newcomb, dwelling in Thames-street over against Baynards Castle.,

notesStmt.note: The words "its present state, .. liberty, &c." are bracketed together on title page.
Variant 1: quire C wrongly imposed; last four pages paginated 17, [blank], 19, 18. Variant 2: quire C wrongly imposed in another way or mispaginated; last four pages paginated 17, [blank], 18, 19.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
With: The declaration of the Esquire at Arms. [London? : s.n., 1653].

person.persName: J. W., well-wisher to the publique.
